description:
Add "View Playlist" Button to Mobile Interface

Implement a "View Playlist" button that is visible and fully functional on mobile devices.

Requirements:
- Add a clearly visible "View Playlist" button on the mobile version of the interface
- Position the button in an accessible location that doesn't conflict with existing mobile navigation
- Ensure the button meets minimum touch target size of 44x44px for mobile usability
- Style the button to match existing mobile design patterns and theme
- Implement appropriate action when button is tapped (navigate to playlist view or open playlist modal)
- Verify button remains accessible across all common mobile screen sizes (320px to 768px width)
- Test functionality in both portrait and landscape orientations
- Ensure button is visible in all relevant app states (scrolled, with keyboard open, etc.)

Edge cases to consider:
- Very small screens (iPhone SE 320px width) - button should remain fully visible and tappable
- Tablets in mobile breakpoint (768px) - maintain consistent behavior
- Devices with notches or safe area insets - ensure button doesn't get obscured
- When playlist is empty or unavailable - handle gracefully with appropriate messaging
- Rapid tapping or double-tap scenarios - prevent duplicate actions
- Loading states - provide feedback if playlist takes time to load

Success criteria:
- Users can easily find and tap the "View Playlist" button on any mobile device
- Button responds immediately to touch input with appropriate visual feedback
- Playlist displays correctly after button activation
- No layout shifts or visual glitches when button appears or is interacted with
title: Fix mobile playlist UI and responsiveness issues
